alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 02 at 2:03PM MDT until April 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Blizzard conditions expected Monday afternoon into Wednesday for the Black Hills and western South Dakota... .A strong spring snowstorm will bring very heavy snow to the area, beginning across northeastern Wyoming and southwestern South Dakota Monday morning, spreading northeastward through the day. Winds will increase Monday with widespread 45-65 mph gusts across the area Tuesday afternoon, strongest winds across the western South Dakota plains. The combination of very heavy snow, strong winds, and blowing and drifting snow will result in very difficult travel conditions late Monday through Wednesday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Strongest winds expected Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. * WHERE...In South Dakota, the Northern Black Hills, the Central Black Hills and the Southern Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...From noon Monday to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
